speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when these episodes of unresponsiveness started happening? Were they sudden or did they come on gradually?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started about a month ago, and they've been happening pretty much every day since then. It feels like they come out of nowhere, and I don't really remember what happens before or after they start."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about what happens during these episodes - do you experience any numbness, tingling, or weakness in your face or extremities, and do these episodes last for a short period of time or can they go on for several minutes?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't feel anything weird before they start, just a weird taste in my mouth. And then... I don't know, it's like my brain just stops working, I guess. They last for a few minutes, but it feels like forever."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about this "weird taste" you mentioned before the episodes start? Is it something bitter, metallic, or do you associate it with any particular foods or drinks? Also, have you noticed any triggers or patterns to when these episodes occur - such as after eating certain foods, during certain times of the day, or in response to any specific stimuli?

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, doc, it's just a muddy taste. It's not really bitter or metallic, it's just... yucky. I don't really associate it with anything, but I've noticed that they happen more often when I'm stressed or tired. And sometimes, like when I'm watching TV or playing video games, I'll just start staring and grimacing for no reason, even if nothing's going on."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your stress levels? Do you find that your episodes occur when you're under a lot of pressure at work, school, or in your personal life?

speaker: Patient
text: "Uh-huh, I guess I do get stressed out a lot, especially with school and stuff. My brother always says I get really mad when I'm playing video games or watching TV, and sometimes I just get really frustrated and... and I don't know, it's like my brain just stops working, I guess. I don't really think it's because of anything I'm doing, though - it just feels like my brain just gets stuck or something."

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm concerned about these episodes, and I want to get to the bottom of what's causing them. Can you tell me more about your daily routine, especially when it comes to your sleep patterns? Do you find that you're getting enough restful sleep, and are there any changes in your sleep that might be contributing to these episodes? And by the way, I'd like to perform a neurological exam to check for any abnormalities in your reflexes and muscle tone. speaker: Patient
text: "I try to go to bed at the same time every night, and I usually sleep for around 10 hours. My parents make sure I get enough rest, but sometimes I wake up during the night and feel really confused and disoriented. I don't remember what happened, though. And yeah, I can do the neurological exam thing, doc. Just ask me to do something, and I'll try my best."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you please stand up and walk for me, then stop suddenly and look around the room? I want to observe your muscle tone and reflexes.

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, doc... I'll do it. *gets up and starts walking* I'll stop... *stops suddenly and looks around the room, blinking slowly*"

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you please lift your right arm up and hold it straight out in front of you, and then lower it back down slowly? I want to observe your reflexes and muscle tone.

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, doc... I'll do it. *lifts right arm up and holds it straight out in front of me, then slowly lowers it back down* It feels a bit stiff, but I think it's just because I've been sitting for a while."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your daily activities, especially those that require concentration or mental effort? Do you find that you're more prone to these episodes when you're doing something mentally demanding, such as studying or working on a project? Also, I'd like to request a test to check for any abnormalities in your brain function. REQUEST TEST: EEG
